entry.title: [Payments] Stub virtual card enrollment bottom sheet bridge
entry.content:
Before this patch, Android always showed an infobar UI for virtual card

enrollment.



This patch adds a stub Android bridge for virtual card enrollment, which

is used when the following flag is enabled:

chrome://flags/#autofill-enable-payments-android-bottom-sheet



After this patch, if the flag is enabled, then Android will use the

stub bottom sheet bridge class for virtual card enrollment. The stub

Android bridge has no UI and no implementation.

entry.title: [gc] Apply MPC and inheritance directly in ComputedStyle's constructor.
entry.content:
Currently, when creating a new ComputedStyle object, we would be

first setting provisional subgroup pointers (based on the UA initial

style), and then overwrite parts of it using inheritance and MPC data.

For instance, for the worst-case situation of a partial MPC hit,

we could see something like this:



1. Construct the object; increase the refcount of all subgroups.

2. Call InheritFrom() with the parent; decrease the refcount of

all the subgroups we used to have, increase the refcount of

all the newly copied subgroups.

3. Look up in the MPC, and find the partial hit.

4. Call InheritFrom() with the returned style from MPC; decrease

the refcount of all the subgroups _again_, and instead increase

the refcount of the newly copied ones.



While the above is written in terms of refcounts, the motivation for

this patch is to make it cheaper to move towards having ComputedStyle

on Oilpan, where we have a very similar problem with subobject Member<>

pointer changes creating GC barriers (which can hit a slow path) --

with the important exception that no barriers can happen if the pointer

is set _during the constructor_ (because the ComputedStyle does not

exist yet, so it could not possibly be in the process of being traced

by a background thread). Thus, we want to move as much as possible of

this work into the constructor, setting the subgroup pointers once

there and then be done with it. (Of course, any later Set* would be

modifying the pointers as part of copy-on-write; this is something we

can only fix by moving fully towards a build-once pattern, which this

patch does not attempt.)



Thus, we replace InheritFrom() and CopyNonInheritedFromCached()

with a completely new constructor patterns, which takes in styles

to take inherited and non-inherited subgroups from, and merge the

subgroups in the constructors as needed. (The only real edge case

here is the SVG subgroup, which contains a mix of inherited and

non-inherited properties, so we need to merge that recursively

in the same way.) This means we cannot construct a ComputedStyle

until after the MPC lookup has happened -- this also means that

a lot of the old code which assumed a provisional ComputedStyle

existed (sometimes with certain properties already being set,

sometimes just assuming they were at the UA initial values)

had to be cleaned up, which has happened in some of the previous

patches.



This also fixes the issue where reset_on_new_style (formerly

custom_copy) fields in raredata groups would not be correctly

reset when creating a new style.



Style perftest (Zen 2, LTO but no PGO):

the browser tests by forcing the creation of the services, instead of

relying on the services that are only created on Profile Initialization.



This way we make sure that each factory will have to properly define

its profile type scope, and not rely on run time exceptions for validity.



Only issue remains with components/ factory that cannot yet have a way

to differentiate profile types.

entry.title: [bookmarks] Delete sync-ed bookmarks if recently restored from backup
entry.content:
The new logic is guarded behind feature flags (one of which is a

dedicated kill switch).



The approach is based on the following design:

1) Upon construction of BookmarkSyncService, in the factory, it can

be determined reliably whether this browser startup corresponds to

a state that was just restored from a backup (Apple's backup, since

this patch is specific to ios/). The outcome is plumbed through in

the form a newly-introduced enum, WipeModelUponSyncDisabledPolicy,

that generalizes a previously-existing boolean for similar reasons.



2) Depending on what the user does in the initial interactions

(immediately following the restore-from-backup), the browser may

remain signed in (theoretical only, because in practice the user

would never be fast enough) or sign out.



3) For the latter case, SyncService would find itself stopped and invoke

each datatype's ClearMetadataWhileStopped(), with the original goal

to avoid left-behind sync metadata for signed-out users.



4) This particular cleanup logic is intercepted, specifically for

bookmarks, in TriggerWipeModelUponSyncDisabledPolicy(), and the

local bookmarks are deleted because they must have been uploaded to

the user account (and could otherwise lead to duplicates).



Change-Id: I45ee74af49fd61a5c1ecca43253b4525c4d03f28

Bug: 1468502

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4727928

Reviewed-by: Jérôme Lebel

Reviewed-by: Rushan Suleymanov

Commit-Queue: Mikel Astiz

Reviewed-by: Marc Treib

entry.title: [BestEffortServiceWorker] Fix the data stuck issue while data transfer
entry.content:
The process of the data transfer in RaceNetworkRequest is like below:

1. Read the response data from the original data pipe

2. Write the chunk of data to the pipe for the RaceNetworkRequest

3. Write the chunk of data to the pipe for the fetch handler (dedupe)

4. If all 1) 2) 3) processes are succeeded, commit the result.



This is fine in most cases. However, when the actual data size is larger

than the default data pipe buffer size, which is currently 2MB, the data

pipe may return |MOJO_RESULT_SHOULD_WAIT| unless stacked data is

consumed.



It's possible that the data pipe for the fetch handler when the fetch

handler is fallback, or it never callls `fetch`. In that case the data

transfer is stcuk with 3), hence the entire process is stopped. It

results in a request pending status.



This CL fixes that problem by having 1) consume data pipe from the fetch

handler even if it's not actually used. 2) Cancel the data transfer when

we get |MOJO_RESULT_SHOULD_WAIT|.



Change-Id: Ie322d41b92c69643925b04b1d499adb5c2d8ba92

Bug: 1420517

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4735465

entry.title: Cookie Controls: Ignore focus loss for reloading view
entry.content:
On MacOS, there are multiple focus loss events fired when the main view

is closed. This causes the reloading view to be immediately closed as

well.



This CL tweaks the logic so that the reloading view ignores focus loss

for closing. The reloading view will only be displayed while the page

is reloading, and can still be manually closed.

entry.title: [Sync] Tentatively deflake SingleClientNigoriWithWebApiTest tests
entry.content:
This CL attempts to deflake

ShouldAcceptEncryptionKeysFromTheWebBeforeSignIn and

ShouldRecordTrustedVaultErrorShownOnStartupWhenErrorNotShown tests.



Pre-existing waiting conditions in PRE_ tests don't look sufficient:

1. Retrieval tab closed after StoreKeys() task posted to

StandaloneTrustedVaultBackend not waiting for its completion.

2. TrustedVaultKeysChangedStateChecker runs into the same issue:

NotifyKeysChanged() called as soon as StoreKeys() task posted.



This CL keeps only 1. and makes use of WaitForFlushForTesting() to

ensure that StoreKeys() task completes before finishing PRE_ test.

entry.title: Replace bool with an enum in as suggested in DevtoolsManagerDelegate.
entry.content:
This was suggested in http://crrev.com/c/4712425/comment/eb7b821f_6fb95ceb/



The enum described a Chrome Devtools Protocol Target type to use, whereas bool referred to a using tab target specifically.



Before MPArch frame targets were used, which correspond to the primary outermost frame in the WebContents. With prerender and other MPArch features, there could be multiple outermost frames per WebContents. To make debugging them possible, DevTools protocol introduced a tab target which is a parent of all outermost frames in the WebContents.



Bug: 1457418

entry.title: Reland "Move ownership of CrdAdminSessionController up"
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit 90246d75cfa97bd8460e5b96e769755dda3b9640



The original commit forgot to update the fuzzer tests

(which apparently are not even compiled during CQ).



Original change's description:

> Move ownership of CrdAdminSessionController up

>

> Previously it was owned by the DeviceCommandsFactoryAsh,

> which has always been a bit of a convenience choice and not really a

> deliberate design,

> so this CL moves it up to BrowserPolicyConnectorAsh, which is a more

> logical parent since it already owns lots of components required for

> the device cloud policy implementation.

>

> Other changes in this CL:

> * Move `DeviceCommandStartCrdSessionJob::Delegate` to a stand-alone

> class `StartCrdSessionJobDelegate`, as that makes passing this

> delegate along easier (since you can not forward declare nested

> classes).

> * Remove dependency of `DeviceCommandFactoryAsh` on

> `DeviceCloudPolicyManagerAsh` (since it only needed a single field

> of that class).

>

entry.title: iwa: Add class to wait for the right moment to apply an update
entry.content:
The new `IsolatedWebAppUpdateApplyWaiter`'s responsibility is to wait

for the right moment to a apply a pending, prepared, and stored update.

For now, all it does is to wait for all windows of the IWA to close.

Later, it might do more sophisticated things, like showing a message to

the user and waiting for the user to click "perform update now".



The next CL will implement a new task type for actually applying the

update.



Low-Coverage-Reason: Some debug and logging code does not need tests.

IsolatedWebAppUpdateManager will receive more

coverage as part of the upcoming CLs in this chain.

entry.title: [ios] Avoid false positives in IsFirstSessionAfterDeviceRestore()
entry.content:
In extremely rare cases, if I/O fails and one of the two involved files

cannot be created, it was possible before this patch that

IsFirstSessionAfterDeviceRestore() returned true.



With this patch, the edge case is avoided by more carefully creating the

files. Namely, the backed-up file should only be created if the

not-backed-up one has been successfully created, avoiding the

problematic scenario of a false positive due to the only presence of

the backed-up file (indistinguishable from a real restored-from-backup

case).



The opposite (symmetric case), where the creation of the backed-up file

fails doesn't affect the function: it returns signin::Tribool::kUnknown

regardless.



Another minor improvement in the patch is that, if setResourceValue()

fails, i.e. the exclusion of the file from backups, the file is deleted,

which allows retrying the entire logic in the next startup.



Bug: 1468502

Change-Id: I6f357b8b52f576bc33245e2c8df618a28b431745

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4729894

Reviewed-by: Jérôme Lebel

Commit-Queue: Mikel Astiz

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1178902}

entry.title: Reland "dlp: Show desktop notif. when all files apps close"
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit 101c7b25fe135948e411418c4f706790465e0778



The change was reverted because it was causing some test failures,

namely it caused the CHECK in FPNM::ShowFilesPolicyNotification() to

fail as it was expecting that, once we call that function, we either

have warning or blocked files for the task. This is not the case at

all times, because resuming the task after a warning can take some

time due to the communication between Chrome, DLP daemon, and the Files

app - there is some time between resuming the task in FPNM, when we

clear all the stored warning info, and actually resuming the task by

moving it from kPaused to kInProgress state. If during this time, we

close all instances of the Files app (e.g. when the test finishes), this

loops over all paused tasks (so including the one that's "resuming") &

notifies all observers, including SystemNotificationManager and FPNM.



To account for this, we now only show notifications if there are any

warning or blocked files, rather than failing on the CHECK.



Original change's description:

> dlp: Show desktop notif. when all files apps close

>

> Ensures that any opened DLP panel items are moved to a desktop (system)

> notification, in case all Files app windows close:

> * Changes `IOTask::IsPaused()` to include tasks paused by DLP warning

> * This then works because `IOTaskController::ProgressPausedTasks()`

> force-sends a status update and the desktop notification is shown.

> * For error notifications, i.e. when the task is blocked by DLP, we

> don't track the task anymore in the controller, but we do have all the

> info in `FilesPolicyNotificationManager`

> * Adds a function in FPNM to loop over tracked IOTasks and show the

> notifications for those with errors.

> * Calls this function in the `FileManagerUI` dtor, when the last

> instance is being destroyed.

>

> The only case not covered is the timeout notification, as when this is

> visible, the `FPNM` also doesn't track the task anymore, but it could

> be fixed. However, it requires more changes in `FPNM` so will be done

> in a separate CL if needed.

>

> R=lucmult@chromium.org,chromeos-dlp@google.com

>

> Bug: b:290903069

> Change-Id: Ia66cbbaa12a8911235dd02eafd4b4bedf4ccc5b0

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4711968

> Reviewed-by: Aya Elsayed

> Commit-Queue: Aida Zolic

> Reviewed-by: Luciano Pacheco

> Reviewed-by: Daniel Brinkers

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1178312}

entry.title: Add CHECKs to enforce valid format strings
entry.content:
Format strings are used by Autofill to merge multiple nodes' values into

a single value for their parent node. These strings are hardcoded into

the code and this CL adds checks to ensure that the strings are valid.



More specifically, we CHECK that:

-Whenever a control sequence starts, the previous one (if any) did end.

-Whenever we reach the end character of a control sequence there is one

that started previously and didn't end yet.

-The last control sequence ends.



Bug: 1440504

entry.title: Treat Settings::GetPrintingMaximumShrinkFactor() as-is.
entry.content:
We used to divide it by 1.33333333 by "accident", because the printing

code used the 1.33333333 factor as an encryption key, to make everything

hard to understand, prior to CL:4567866.



Adjust the default value of the printingMaximumShrinkFactor setting

accordingly, so that there won't be any behavior changes unless that

value is overridden. If the value *is* overridden, on the other hand

(this should be rare), the user may now be surprised to see that the

value specified will actually be respected, rather than be divided by

1.3333333. But hopefully this is acceptable.



Bug: 1296099

Change-Id: I376aeafb269f69e8bc15fd4751dfa171f6926037

the payments client outlived the TestPersonalDataManager.

order inside TestAutofillClient. It also transitions the unit test

for VirtualCardEnrollmentManager to use the test client's PDM instead

of creating their own.

entry.title: Allow calling registerRouter if past attempts failed.
entry.content:
With the current code, the registerRouter method can be called only once

even if the promise is rejected due to input failures. It brings

difficulty in API usage because once the API call is failed, the API

cannot be called again even if the API did not work.

To solve the behavior, this CL makes the flag set at the end of the

method after the mojo call to the browser process happened.



Bug: 1469781, 1371756

Change-Id: I5d0a4c796b6b815b56a3ba1ffafeb6ff99d76af7

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4745800

Reviewed-by: Minoru Chikamune

Commit-Queue: Yoshisato Yanagisawa

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1178863}

entry.title: [BestEffortServiceWorker] Fix NOTREACHED() crash
entry.content:
When the RaceNetworkRequest data is processed, it seems that sometimes

BeginReadData() from the original data pipe returns

MOJO_RESULT_SHOULD_WAIT. This mojo error result might happen when

BeginReadData() is called but EndReadData() is not called yet, and the

next iteration is triggered and BeginReadData() is called again.



It's not fully convinced, but for now, we treat is as the same as

|MOJO_RESULT_BUSY|.



Also, MojoResult will be recorded in crrev.com/c/4744162



Bug: 1469213

Change-Id: I9a7d9ba4ed5da0f69361f928ae01561c4e4656df

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4741218

Reviewed-by: Yoshisato Yanagisawa

Commit-Queue: Shunya Shishido

entry.content:
The new opt guide model store saved absolute model dirs to be deleted in the next Chrome startup. But the absolute dirs could become non-existent, if IOS Chrome upgrade changes the sandbox dirs.



This CL saves the relative model dirs to be deleted instead, and also handles the absolute model dir case for backward compatibility.

entry.title: Call kiosk_ash_starter_.SetUpBrowserManager in PreRunTestOnMainThread
entry.content:
Previously, tests inheriting from WebKioskLacrosBaseTest were

initializing a fake DeviceOwnershipWaiter for BrowserManager

in SetUpOnMainThread.



However, that turns out to be too late, because when if we

prelaunching Lacros at login screen, the DeviceOwnershipWaiter

has already been called, causing the test to fail.



This change addresses the issue by anticipating the call.



BUG=None

TEST=browser_tests

entry.title: [iOS] CBDCoordinator requests its owner to stop it
entry.content:
Instead of stopping itself, it request its owner to dismiss it.



Note that:

* HistoryCoordinator dismissHistory calls its delegate’s closeHistoryWithCompletion

* both implementation of closeHistoryWithCompletion calls’s HistoryCoordinator’s dismissWithCompletion

* dismissWithCompletion calls HistoryCBD’s calls stopWithCompletion (assuming that navigation controller and cbd are set, which should be the case given that historyCBD is not yet stopped)



So `stopWithCompletion` is still called, but this time, allowing its owner to react



Change-Id: I857fcb4256214b4bfad965198e29c0bd520c6e9d

entry.title: [BestEffortServiceWorker] Add UMA to record mojo results
entry.content:
When RaceNetworkRequest is triggered, two data pipes are created and

response data is copied to both data pipes. While the data processing,

we see some unexpected mojo resutls according to the crash logs.



This CL adds UMA to record each mojo result in the read/write process.

We defined a dedicated enum class not to enforce the rule from the

histogram guideline to the original MojoResult.

entry.content:

Reason for revert: Found a better solution: crrev.com/c/4737613



Original change's description:

> Make Ash source of truth for PdfOcrAlwaysActive pref.

>

> PdfOcrAlwaysActive preference is kept both in LaCrOS and Ash, and kept

> in sync for all active profiles. But if user changes the pref when a

> profile is not active, the pref will not be updated in that profile.

>

> To fix the issue, the pref value is feteched from Ash when

entry.title: NoCopyBack: Improve performance of zero margins
entry.content:
After crrev.com/1173244 , we allocated PhysicalFragmentRareData for

every block-flow children even if margins are zero, and it caused a

performance regression. This CL fixes the regression.



The performance of many-block-children-auto-inline-size.html on my

local machine:



* Before crrev.com/1173244 :

avg 361.3 runs/s, median 360.6 runs/s



* After crrev.com/1173244 :

avg 335.5 runs/s, median 335.8 runs/s



* With this CL:

avg 373.2 runs/s, median 372.7 runs/s



Bug: 1353190, 1466783

entry.title: Use InlinedVector in /components/history/core/browser
entry.content:
Replace usages of base::StackVector with absl::InlinedVector. This is

not a pure rename, as the semantics are slightly different:



1. Methods like push_back() which were accessed with the -> operator in

StackVector are instead accessed with . with InlinedVector.



See also discussion thread in cxx@chromium.org:

https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/g/cxx/c/jTfqVfU-Ka0/m/caaal90NCgAJ



This CL was uploaded by git cl split.

entry.title: Simplify User to Profile mapping in ProfileHelper for testing.
entry.content:
Currently, the mapping is manually tracked by calling

SetProfileToUserMappingForTesting and RemoveUserFromListForTesting.

However, this approach occasionally causes some unexpected mapping.



With this CL, ProfileHelper just traverse all users in the

current (maybe injected by test/fixtures) UserManager's users,

instead of the ones explicitly registered via the methods.



Along with the change, properly inject global fake UserManagers.

entry.title: bindings: Fix the exposure of the [RuntimeEnabeld] overloaded operation
entry.content:
This patch fixes the exposure condition of the overloaded operations

in the following case:

```

interface X {

[RuntimeEnabled=X] foo();

[RuntimeEnabled=Y] foo(long value);

};

```

Before this patch, the exposure condition was (X && Y), but

after this patch, the exposure condition is (X || Y).



A more complicated case is explained in the bug 1466341.



Bug: 1466341

entry.title: Revert "[webauthn] Refactor cable pairings"
entry.content:
This reverts commit e067c261a6e997238f155823761b90df98f52d85.



Reason for revert: Suspected culprit for Linux MSan failures starting from https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Linux%20ChromiumOS%20MSan%20Tests/37570/overview



Original change's description:

> [webauthn] Refactor cable pairings

>

> Chrome maintains two lists of paired phones for a webauthn request: one

> on cablev2::Discovery and another on AuthenticatorRequestDialogModel.

> This CL updates Chrome to maintain a single list on

> AuthenticatorRequestDialogModel instead. Callbacks taking indices are

> replaced by callbacks taking Pairing objects instead.

>

> This will make passing cable pairing data to Windows easier (see

> follow-up).

>

> Bug: 1453259

> Change-Id: Id485bb5e23c26f179a03b1c2f0ae3f629dcc1420

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4735132

> Reviewed-by: Adam Langley

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1178718}

entry.title: [Promise Icons] Delete promise app when app installation completes
entry.content:
Make PromiseAppService an observer of AppRegistryCache so that when a

new app has been installed (i.e. the app is registered for the first

its components (including the PromiseAppRegistryCache and

PromiseAppIconCache).

entry.title: CrOS GMC V2: Add new media view for lock screen
entry.content:
If media::kGlobalMediaControlsCrOSUpdatedUI is enabled, create

LockScreenMediaView with the updated media view UI in

MediaNotificationViewAshImpl to replace LockScreenMediaControlsView.



LockScreenMediaView has a unique dismiss button that needs to be added

into MediaNotificationViewAshImpl. Since LockScreenMediaView listens to

media updates directly and does not provide any MediaNotificationItem,

it needs to handle button/seek events as a MediaNotificationContainer.



Move MediaNotificationViewAshImpl related files under

components/global_media_controls/public/views/ so that they can be

accessed in ash/login/ui/.



Unit tests will be added in follow-up CLs to reduce this CL's size.



Bug: 1448702

Change-Id: Ie547aceafd94bcc9bac999410d3019aebe3d6211

entry.title: Support (behind a flag) any CSS display on <details> and <summary>.
entry.content:
This adds a new DetailsStyling flag (and virtual test suite) that is

intended as a feature flag for a set of changes for improving the

ability to style the
and elements.



It also adds the first change to that flag, which allows the


and elements to take any value of the CSS display property

(instead of forcing
to be a block or list item, and

to be one of a slightly larger but still restricted list).

entry.title: AW: refactor testAllClientHints
entry.content:
No change to logic. This refactors testAllClientHints to use an array

rather than a long string literal. Using an array makes it easier to

add/remove client hints and keep track of what we're actually testing.



While I wrote this I realized that the length of the array is not equal

to the hard-coded number of client hints. This was because ch-lang was

removed in M96. This removes that hint from the test since it's no

longer relevant.



Test: run_webview_instrumentation_test_apk -f ClientHintsTest.*

entry.title: Correct behavior of quirks mode use counters, and add one for about:blank.
entry.content:
This corrects the behavior of the use counters for quirks mode, which

previously appear to only have recorded usage of quirks mode when the

compatibility mode is changed *away* from quirks mode. The only cases I

see where that happens involve (implicit or explicit) document.open(),

though I could certainly be missing something.



It also adds a use counter for about:blank on the theory that that may

be a significant portion of quirks mode usage.



Bug: 1469336

Change-Id: Icda6522338ff08822678426b8b02e8407e275c66

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4739393

Commit-Queue: David Baron

Reviewed-by: Mason Freed

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1178775}

entry.title: Remove third-party cookie check for URLLoader
entry.content:
Now that CacheTransparency code is removed, the third-party cookie check

is no longer needed in URLLoader. This CL removes the check.

entry.title: metrics: Replace TPM firmware version with TPM RW firmware version
entry.content:
We are not interested in the TPM RW firmware version, But not the TPM

firmware verision, so report the former one. Report TPM RW firmware

type in ChromeOSMetricsProvider is done by getting the rw_version from

GetVersionInfo TPM manager dbus calls.
